lines.text: Inconsiderate, that's what I call it, distinctly inconsiderate.
Well they don't need to die in my house.
Lots of people have, masses of stuffy old great grandfathers and grandmothers.
That's quite different. Of course I expect family to die here. But I do object to strangers!
Eh, everything's last words. Your grandfather said 'Pass the mustard,'and off he went just like that!
Gentlemen that have no sense of humor take themselves too seriously, and that leads to mischief.
Mind you, I always thought if God made women to play golf, he'd have made them different.
You really shouldn't go about shooting people, you know. They don't like it. I dare say some of them richly deserve it, but it only leads to trouble in the end.
A great man always knows better than to explain unless an explanation is demanded.
Well, how long have you been? I mean when did you come to?
Why didn't you open your eyes or say something?
I didn't want to. I was enjoying myself. Listening to all those nice things you were saying. You will never say them so nicely again. You'll be too beastly self conscious.
The crimial, he had an evil voice. The other one was cultured, English, a gentleman I think. He was swearing a lot.
